faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.description: Here you'll find answers to the most common questions about vehicle registration, re-registration, and deregistration. Our Express Service supports you with all inquiries quickly and easily.

question1.title: What do you need to register a car?
question1.intro: To register a vehicle, you need the following documents:
question1.doc1: Registration certificate (Zulassungsbescheinigung Teil I) and vehicle title (Zulassungsbescheinigung Teil II)
question1.doc2: Valid ID card or passport (for foreign nationals, additionally a passport copy)
question1.doc3: eVB number (electronic insurance confirmation) from your car insurance
question1.doc4: SEPA direct debit mandate for vehicle tax
question1.doc5: If applicable: valid vehicle inspection (HU) report
question1.doc6: If you use our service: power of attorney and order form
question1.closing: With our Express Service, we take care of the entire process for you – fast, simple, and without waiting times!

step1.title: Prepare documents:
step1.text: Gather all required documents (registration certificate, vehicle title, ID, eVB number, SEPA mandate)

step2.title: Get insurance:
step2.text: Contact your car insurance and obtain the eVB number

step3.title: Visit registration office:
step3.text: Go to the responsible registration office or use our Express Service

step4.title: Complete registration:
step4.text: Documents are verified, vehicle tax is calculated, and the vehicle is registered in the system

step5.title: Receive license plates:
step5.text: You get your license plates and the new registration certificate

closing.text: You hand us your documents, and we handle everything for you in the shortest time – nationwide and without an appointment!

question3.title: What's the difference between registration and re-registration?
question3.intro: The difference between registration and re-registration:

registration.title: Registration (first-time or re-registration):
registration.point1: Required when a vehicle is registered for the first time or was decommissioned
registration.point2: The vehicle receives completely new license plates and is newly registered in the system
registration.point3: Necessary after purchasing a decommissioned vehicle or for new cars

reregistration.title: Re-registration:
reregistration.point1: Required when moving to a different registration district (outside the county)
reregistration.point2: Or when changing ownership (selling/buying a registered vehicle)
reregistration.point3: The vehicle is transferred to a new owner or new address
reregistration.point4: For moves within the same county, only an address change is required

question3.closing: Our service supports you with both processes quickly and professionally!

question4.title: How much does it cost to register a car with license plates?
question4.intro: The costs for vehicle registration with license plates consist of several components:

plates.title: License plates:
plates.standard: Standard license plates: approx. 20-30 euros (both plates)
plates.custom: Personalized license plates: additional fee approx. 10-13 euros

additional.title: Additional costs:
additional.insurance: Car insurance (varies depending on vehicle and coverage)

total.title: Total:
total.text: Registration costs typically range between 60-100 euros, depending on individual requirements.

question4.closing: With our Express Service, you get a transparent complete package including professional handling!

question5.title: What comes first, license plates or registration?

principle.title: Basically:
principle.text: Registration comes first, then you receive the license plates.

process.title: The usual process:
process.step1: You go to the registration office with all required documents
process.step2: The registration office checks your documents and completes the registration
process.step3: After successful registration, you receive the registration seal and stamp
process.step4: With these documents, you can have the license plates made (at our shop or a license plate service)

alternative.title: Modern alternative:
alternative.text: You can have license plates made in advance at a license plate service and have them stamped directly during registration. This saves time!

service.title: With our Express Service:
service.text: We take care of everything – from registration to finished, stamped license plates. You get your road-ready vehicle back!

question6.title: Is it allowed to drive to the registration office without license plates?
question6.answer: No, driving without license plates is generally not allowed and can be fined.

shortterm.title: Short-term license plates (5-day plates):
shortterm.text: Specifically for test drives and transfers to the registration office. Valid for 5 days.

red.title: Red license plates:
red.text: Only for dealers and workshops for test drives and transfers

trailer.title: Trailer/transport:
trailer.text: You can bring the vehicle to the registration office on a trailer or with a tow truck

recommendation.title: Recommendation:
recommendation.text: Use a short-term license plate or our Express Service. We pick up your vehicle and return it registered with all license plates – legal and safe!

stamp.title: Have plates made:

bring.title: Bring to registration:

advantage.title: Advantage:
advantage.text: You save time because you don't need to go to a license plate service after registration. The license plates are immediately ready to use!

important.title: Important:
important.text: The license plates are only valid after official registration and stamping. You may not drive with them beforehand!

question8.closing: Our Express Service offers complete packages including license plate making and stamping – everything from one source!

question9.title: What do I need to deregister a vehicle at the registration office?
question9.intro: To deregister (decommission) your vehicle, you need:

plates.title: Both license plates:
plates.text: Front and rear license plates must be returned

notes.title: Important notes:
notes.brief: The vehicle title (Zulassungsbescheinigung Teil II) is not required for deregistration
notes.costs: Deregistration is free or costs only a few euros (approx. 5-10 euros depending on registration office)
notes.insurance: After deregistration, you must inform your car insurance
notes.traffic: The vehicle may not be moved in public traffic after deregistration

info.heading: Customs Plates / Export Plates: Everything You Need to Know
info.intro: Export plates, also known as customs plates, are the perfect solution for vehicle owners who want to export a vehicle abroad or drive temporarily in a foreign country. In this article, we explain how to apply for customs plates, what requirements are needed, and what benefits they offer.

sub1.title: What are customs plates (export plates)?
sub1.text: Customs plates are special license plates issued for vehicles that are temporarily or permanently moved to another country. These plates allow you to drive a vehicle abroad without having to permanently register or deregister it in Germany beforehand. Customs plates are the ideal solution for vehicle exports or trips abroad.

sub2.title: Advantages of customs plates (export plates)
points: Temporary use for export: If you want to export a vehicle abroad, customs plates allow you to use the vehicle for a specific time without full re-registration.
International use: With customs plates, you can also drive outside of Germany without needing permanent re-registration.
Validity: The customs plates are valid for a fixed period depending on how long the export or foreign use is planned.
Insurance coverage: Vehicles with customs plates are usually insured, so you are covered while driving abroad.

sub3.title: Requirements for applying for customs plates
sub3.subtitle: Certain documents and conditions must be met to apply for customs plates. These include:
points: Original vehicle documents: You must present the original vehicle documents (registration certificate parts I and II).
Valid general inspection (TÜV): The vehicle must have a valid general inspection (TÜV).

sub4.title: Procedure for applying for customs plates
sub4.subtitle: There are two different scenarios for applying for customs plates:
sub4.scenario1: 1. Customer with foreign residence present on site: If the vehicle owner has a foreign residence but is present in Germany, the vehicle can be presented directly at the registration office with the appropriate vehicle documents and valid TÜV. We take care of the entire registration process and issue the customs plates quickly.
sub4.scenario2: 2. Customer with foreign residence not present: For customers with foreign residence who cannot be present, we offer a special solution: you do not need to present the vehicle yourself at the registration office. Instead, the vehicle can be presented by us or an authorized representative as long as the vehicle documents and valid TÜV are available. We also take care of the entire registration and issue the customs plates in this case.

feature.title: Our special service: Customs plates without the vehicle owner's presence
feature.text: Compared to other registration services, we offer the advantage that you do not have to appear in person to obtain customs plates – even if you live abroad. The only requirement is that the vehicle is presented at the registration office and all necessary documents are available. We handle the rest and ensure everything goes smoothly.

service.title: Why our service for customs plates?
points: Convenience: We handle all the bureaucracy for you, so you don't have to worry about the registration process.
Speed: We ensure that you receive your customs plates quickly, so you don’t lose time.
Flexibility: Whether you are on site or not, we offer tailored solutions for your needs.
Reliability: Our service is professional and dependable, ensuring everything is done correctly and without delays.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions about Customs Plates (Export Plates)

q1.question: 1. How long are customs plates valid?
q1.answer: Customs plates are generally valid for a period of 15 days up to one year, depending on your needs.

q2.question: 2. Do I need insurance for my vehicle with customs plates?
q2.answer: Yes, you need insurance to drive with customs plates. We are happy to help you get the right insurance.

q3.question: 3. Can I get customs plates for any vehicle?
q3.answer: Yes, any vehicle that meets the required conditions (original documents and valid TÜV) can receive customs plates.

conclusion.title: Conclusion: Your Partner for Customs Plates and Export Plates
conclusion.text: Whether you're exporting a vehicle or temporarily driving abroad, customs plates are the ideal solution. We offer fast, hassle-free service – even if you’re not physically present. Contact us today to learn more about our services and to apply for your customs plates.

info.final_cta: Take advantage of customs plates and secure yourself a simple, fast, and flexible service for your vehicle registration!

info.heading: Temporary Plates, Transfer Plates, 6-Day Plates (formerly 5-Day Plates) – Fast, Simple, Convenient
info.intro: If you want to transfer, test drive, or temporarily register a vehicle, temporary plates are the perfect solution. Also known as transfer plates, day plates, or previously as 5-day plates, they allow you to move vehicles legally and with insurance.
info.details: With our registration service, applying for temporary or transfer plates is especially easy: You only need a few documents, which you can conveniently send to us via WhatsApp or email. Since 01.01.2024, our temporary plates are valid for 6 days – a major benefit over the traditional 5-day plate.

sub1.title: What is a temporary license plate?
sub1.subtitle: A temporary license plate, often referred to as a transfer plate, day plate, or 5-day plate, is a temporary registration valid for a limited time. It is ideal for:
texts: Transferring vehicles within Germany or abroad.
Short-term trips for vehicle inspection (HU) or repair, even without valid TÜV.
sub1.note: Our temporary plate is easily recognizable by its yellow border stripe, which displays the expiration date.

sub2.title: Benefits of our Temporary License Plate Service
sub2.subtitle: Our goal is to make applying for a temporary or transfer license plate as easy as possible. With us, you benefit from the following advantages:
texts: Minimal effort: You only need a few documents:
Copy of your ID (front and back).
Copy of your vehicle registration certificate (front and back).
A completed authorization form, which you can easily download from our website.
Fast processing: Send us all documents via WhatsApp or email, and we take care of the rest.
Same-day service: In most cases, we issue your temporary or day license plate on the same day.
6-day validity: Compared to the traditional 5-day plate, ours is valid for an extra day.
Vehicles without TÜV: Even without valid TÜV, you may drive to a TÜV station or garage using a temporary plate.

sub3.subtitle: Applying for a temporary or transfer license plate has never been easier:
texts: Prepare documents: Make sure you have the following documents ready in digital form:
Copy of your ID (front and back).
Copy of your vehicle registration (front and back).
A completed authorization form (available for download on our website).
Submission: Send us these documents conveniently via WhatsApp or email.
Review and processing: We handle the entire process with the registration office.
Delivery or pickup: Your temporary or day license plate will be ready for pickup or shipped upon request.

sub4.title: Why Choose Our Service?
points: Maximum flexibility: Whether you need temporary, transfer, day, or 6-day plates – we’ll handle it quickly and reliably.
Convenience: Skip the hassle of government offices – just send your documents via WhatsApp or email.
Special solutions: We also provide temporary plates without TÜV, as long as legal requirements are met.
Time saving: Thanks to our optimized process, you’ll often receive your plates the same day.

q1.question: How long is a temporary plate valid?
q1.answer: Since 01.01.2024, our temporary plate is valid for 6 days – one day longer than the traditional 5-day plate.

q2.question: Can I use a temporary plate without TÜV?
q2.answer: Yes, temporary plates allow driving to a workshop or TÜV station for inspection.

q3.question: How fast can I get a temporary plate?
q3.answer: In most cases, we issue your plate the same day we receive all documents.

q4.question: Can I use temporary plates for trips abroad?
q4.answer: Yes, temporary plates are ideal for cross-border transport if all vehicle documents are complete.

hero.title: Vehicle Registration Drop-Off Points

hero.how_description: We make vehicle registration easier than ever! With our new service, you can drop off your vehicle documents at a kiosk, stationery store, or similar nearby shop.

steps.title: Submit documents:
text: Bring your vehicle documents to one of our many drop-off points near you.
Pickup by us: Our driver will collect the documents and deliver them to our service center.
